title: The Cassandra Project by Jack McDevitt  Mike Resnick
description:
Early in his career, Jerry Culpepper could never have been accused of being idealistic. Doing public relationsÃ¢â‚¬â€even for politiciansÃ¢â‚¬â€was strictly business...until he was hired as NASAÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s public affairs director and discovered a client he could believe in. Proud of the agencyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s history and sure of its destiny, he was thrilled to be a part of its futureÃ¢â‚¬â€a bright era of far-reaching space exploration.

But public disinterest and budget cuts changed that future. Now, a half century after the first moon landing, Jerry feels like the only one with starsÃ¢â‚¬â€and unexplored planets and solar systemsÃ¢â‚¬â€in his eyes.

Still, Jerry does his job, trying to drum up interest in the legacy of the agency. Then a fifty-year-old secret about the Apollo XI mission is revealed, and he finds himself embroiled in the biggest controversy of the twenty-first century, one that will test his abilityÃ¢â‚¬â€and his willingnessÃ¢â‚¬â€to spin the truth about a conspiracy of reality-altering proportions...
